referred_to_by.content: King Charles I of England(?) (stamped lower left, in gray ink: an eight-pointed star, not in Lugt (see catalog of Barnard sale, p. 7) and according to an inscription on verso of secondary support, in brown ink: E' Collect:ne Regis Caroli Primi. (inscription by John Barnard?) and catalog of Wellesley sale p. 23, cat. no. 336).  Nicholas Lanier or Lanière, London (Lugt 2885, lower right, in black ink and according to inscription on recto of secondary support, lower right, in graphite: Lanière).  Jonathan Richardson Senior, London (Lugt 2184, lower left, in black ink, and Lugt 2983-2984, verso of secondary support, upper center, in brown ink: H.  39 . / W.  9 . / Y. 19. / H. 59.).  Arthur Pond, London (Lugt 2038, verso of secondary support, lower right, in graphite: true / A. Pond).  John Barnard, London (Lugt 1419, recto of secondary support, lower right, in brown ink: J:B~, and Lugt 1420, verso of secondary support, center right, in brown ink: J:B~ N: 471. / 15 3/4 by 11.).  Uvedale Price, Foxley, England (Lugt 2048, not stamped, according to inscription on verso of secondary support, lower center, in brown ink: Price, and catalogs of Wellesley and Bateson sales).  Rev. Dr. Henry Wellesley, Oxford (Lugt 1384, verso of secondary support, upper left, in brown ink: HW  3.5); [his sale London, Sotheby's, 25 June 1866, p. 23, cat. no. 336]; Nowbotharn or Rowbotharn (according to annotatation in catalog of Wellesley sale).  Richard Johnson, Manchester & Chislehurst (Lugt 2216, recto of secondary support, lower left, stamped on separately applied piece of paper); by descent to Richard Johnson Walker (not stamped, see entry under Lugt 2216); William Bateson, London (Lugt 2604a, lower left, in black ink); [his sale London, Sotheby's, 23 April 1929, p. 11, cat. no. 22]; [Thomas Agnew & Sons, London]
